title: Set a placeholder variable
text: You can use a placeholder variable to simplify this problem. Set $$u=3y+2$$.

title: Factor
text: Now, factor the equation so that it is in the form (au~b)(cu~d).

title: Use the Zero Product Property
text: Solve for the variable u by setting each of the two terms equal to zero. Then, once you have found a value for u, plug in the term we substituted for u.

title: Solve
text: Solve for y by setting the equation equal to zero and solving.

title: Check
text: Check all y values(including positive and negative values) you just solved for by plugging them back into the original equation. If the value is correct, the equation will be equal on both sides after solving.
